metadata.Title: CVE-2023-43643 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: AntiSamy is a library for performing fast, configurable cleansing of HTML coming from untrusted sources. Prior to version 1.7.4, there is a potential for a mutation XSS (mXSS) vulnerability in AntiSamy caused by flawed parsing of the HTML being sanitized. To be subject to this vulnerability the `preserveComments` directive must be enabled in your policy file and also allow for certain tags at the same time. As a result, certain crafty inputs can result in elements in comment tags being interpreted as executable when using AntiSamy's sanitized output. This issue has been patched in AntiSamy 1.7.4 and later.

criterions.comment: libowasp-antisamy-java: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
